meanings.definition: To reach full development or completion
meanings.sent1: The fruit maturated on the tree before being picked.
meanings.sent2: The cheese maturated for months to achieve its rich flavor.
meanings.sent3: The idea maturated in his mind like a fine wine, growing better with time.
meanings.sent4: Her skills maturated slowly, like a seed growing into a mighty tree.
meanings.sent5: The friendship maturated over years of shared experiences, becoming unbreakable.

meanings.definition: To undergo the process of maturation
meanings.sent1: The wine maturated in oak barrels to enhance its taste.
meanings.sent2: Children maturated into responsible adults with guidance and experience.
meanings.sent3: His impatience maturated into a newfound sense of calmness over time.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar maturated into a beautiful butterfly, a symbol of transformation.
meanings.sent5: The seed maturated in the soil, bursting forth with new life in the spring.

meanings.sent1: The maturated fruit was sweet and juicy.
meanings.sent2: The maturated cheese had a sharp and tangy flavor.
meanings.sent3: His maturated skills were evident in the flawless performance.
meanings.sent4: The maturated wine was smooth and full-bodied, a delight to the senses.
meanings.sent5: The maturated friendship was strong and enduring, like an ancient oak tree.
